description: Creates a new pool and associates the specified origination identity to the pool. A pool can include one or more phone numbers and SenderIds that are associated with your Amazon Web Services account. The new pool inherits its configuration from the specified origination identity. This includes keywords, message type, opt-out list, two-way configuration, and self-managed opt-out configuration. Deletion protection isn't inherited from the origination identity and defaults to false. If the origination identity is a phone number and is already associated with another pool, an error is returned. A sender ID can be associated with multiple pools.

parameters.name: OriginationIdentity
parameters.description: The origination identity to use such as a PhoneNumberId, PhoneNumberArn, SenderId or SenderIdArn. You can use  DescribePhoneNumbers to find the values for PhoneNumberId and PhoneNumberArn while  DescribeSenderIds can be used to get the values for SenderId and SenderIdArn. After the pool is created you can add more origination identities to the pool by using AssociateOriginationIdentity.

parameters.name: IsoCountryCode
parameters.description: The new two-character code, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format, for the country or region of the new pool.

parameters.name: MessageType
parameters.description: The type of message. Valid values are TRANSACTIONAL for messages that are critical or time-sensitive and PROMOTIONAL for messages that aren't critical or time-sensitive. After the pool is created the MessageType can't be changed.

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: An array of tags (key and value pairs) associated with the pool. (dict) --- The list of tags to be added to the specified topic. The key identifier, or name, of the tag. The string value associated with the key of the tag.

nested_params.name: Key
nested_params.description: The key identifier, or name, of the tag.

nested_params.name: Value
nested_params.description: The string value associated with the key of the tag.

parameters.name: ClientToken
parameters.description: Unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. If you don't specify a client token, a randomly generated token is used for the request to ensure idempotency. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

nested_items.name: PoolArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the pool.

nested_items.name: PoolId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier for the pool.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The current status of the pool.
CREATING: The pool is currently being created and isn't yet available for use.
ACTIVE: The pool is active and available for use.
DELETING: The pool is being deleted.

nested_items.name: MessageType
nested_items.description: The type of message for the pool to use.

nested_items.name: TwoWayEnabled
nested_items.description: By default this is set to false. When set to true you can receive incoming text messages from your end recipients.

nested_items.name: TwoWayChannelArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the two way channel.

nested_items.name: TwoWayChannelRole
nested_items.description: An optional IAM Role Arn for a service to assume, to be able to post inbound SMS messages.

nested_items.name: SelfManagedOptOutsEnabled
nested_items.description: By default this is set to false. When an end recipient sends a message that begins with HELP or STOP to one of your dedicated numbers, AWS End User Messaging SMS and Voice automatically replies with a customizable message and adds the end recipient to the OptOutList. When set to true you're responsible for responding to HELP and STOP requests. You're also responsible for tracking and honoring opt-out requests.

nested_items.name: OptOutListName
nested_items.description: The name of the OptOutList associated with the pool.

nested_items.name: SharedRoutesEnabled
nested_items.description: Indicates whether shared routes are enabled for the pool. Set to false and only origination identities in this pool are used to send messages.

nested_items.name: DeletionProtectionEnabled
nested_items.description: When set to true deletion protection is enabled. By default this is set to false.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: An array of tags (key and value pairs) associated with the pool.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The key identifier, or name, of the tag.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The string value associated with the key of the tag.

nested_items.name: CreatedTimestamp
nested_items.description: The time when the pool was created, in UNIX epoch time format.
